name: Law governing foreign limited liability companies
text:
PART X.  FOREIGN LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANIES
 
     [§428-1001]  Law governing foreign limited liability companies.  (a)  The laws of the state or other jurisdiction under which a foreign limited liability company is organized shall govern its organization and internal affairs and the liability of its managers, members, and their transferees.
     (b)  A foreign limited liability company may not be denied a certificate of authority by reason of any difference between the laws of another jurisdiction under which the foreign limited liability company is organized and the laws of this State.
     (c)  A certificate of authority does not authorize a foreign limited liability company to engage in any business or exercise any power that a limited liability company may not engage in or exercise in this State. [L 1996, c 92, pt of §1]
